intro: Argenope serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering argenope, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its blooming period occurs in the late spring to early summer, producing small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Argenope serotina is noted for its resilience to dry conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
